COVID-19

span.p: The kindergarten preregistration event originally scheduled for Monday, March 30 and Tuesday, March 31 has been indefinitely postponed.
While the physical event is cancelled, West Fargo Public Schools still asks families to complete the electronic preregistration form; this can be done offsite by visiting http://bit.ly/2Sy2QyQ.
Children must be five years old on, or before, July 31, 2020 to attend kindergarten in 2020-2021.
If you do not know which school your child will attend, enter your address online at www.west-fargo.k12.nd.us/maps.

a.title: Go to comments for Kindergarten Preregistration

div.p: The Census determines North Dakota's portion for all federal funds for the next 10 years. For example, the $1.45 billion in federal funds the state received in 2015 was based on the resident counts from the 2010 Census.

a.title: Go to comments for The 2020 U.S. Census is underway!

img.alt: Distance Learning at West Fargo Public Schools

a.span: Distance Learning at West Fargo Public Schools

div.p: During these unprecedented times, West Fargo Public Schools (WFPS) has embraced the challenge to innovate in ways we have talked about, but thought would occur over the next four years.

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning at West Fargo Public Schools

img.alt: Limit the Spread: Practice Social Distancing

a.span: Limit the Spread: Practice Social Distancing

div.p: When the spread of a virus becomes severe, public health officials will take steps to limit the spread of the disease by keeping people from congregating in large groups. This is called social distancing.

a.title: Go to comments for Limit the Spread: Practice Social Distancing

div.p: With the first case of COVID-19 identified in our state, we feel it is important to reaffirm the actions our district has taken in the prevention of the spread of COVID-19.

a.title: Go to comments for District Actions Against COVID-19

img.alt: Reflection on the 2020 State of the Schools Address

a.span: Reflection on the 2020 State of the Schools Address

div.p: On January 23, 2020, the district convened approximately 150 people for the second annual State of the Schools address. The event was open to the public and participants included students (grades 5-12), parents, support staff, teachers, administrators, school board members, city leaders, and state representatives. The purpose of the event was to share the district’s “Profile of a Graduate” and to gather feedback regarding our progress toward our three strategic goals.

a.title: Go to comments for Reflection on the 2020 State of the Schools Address
